history.text: Hello!
We have The wolf of wall street. Have you seen it?
Hi there! Yes, it is one of my favorite films! Have you seen The Wolf of Wall Street starring Leonardo DiCaprio?
I have not seen it, but I love Leonardo's movies
Looks like it is a 2013 American black comedy. And directed by Martin Scorsese.
Its an exceptional film. Rotten Tomatoes gave it a 78%. Do you like black comedies?
Scorsese influence on the film is certainly felt, in a good way.
That isnt too horrible of a score. I do like black comedies.
The rampant corruption Belfort's firm Stratton Oakmont goes through is legendary.
I see it also has Matthew McConaughey in it.

Oh, it's based on a book. Didn'
t know that.
It does have Matthew McConaughey in it. I wonder if he's the reason for some of the critical response such as "an irresponsible glorification rather than a satirical takedown."
Yes, the book is a memoir. Jordan Belfort, the real one not DiCaprio, lived the life portrayed in the movie.
And based on a true story, it seems. The life of Jordan Belfort.
He began his career on Wall Street, where he was introduced to the sex and drug fueled stockbroker culture.
Whats your opinion of the movie so far?
He has an aggressive pitching style and high commissions, making him a small fortune.
Interesting.
I'm always down for a Leonardo DiCaprio film. And Martin Scorsese.
Yeah, McConaughey is a great actor, but can only play certain characters, IMO.
I didnt realize this movie was that old. 2013. I remember wanting to watch it on Netflix, but they removed it before I could.
He does have both of those things. His small fortune was won through fraud, though. Jonah Hill even makes an appearance as DiCaprio's business partner.
Yes, the film did come out many years ago. Though, its still well worth going back to view.
That's cool.
A funny part of the movie is how Jordan creates the name for his brokerage firm.
Wow, he scammed $22 million in 3 hours!
He simply decides that whatever the most respectable-sounding combination of words will do.
Which was a bad movie! It made the FBI suspicious!
Stratton Oakmont. Interesting
Yes, and the smuggling of cash to into Switzerland seems like a larger than life act.
Oh man, he gets out then makes a living hosting seminars on sales technique.
Isn't it unbelievable?
It is.
Poor guy, his friend rats him out.
That and the fact that throughout all this corruption Jordan has close friends snitch on him.
That does suck. At least he only got 3 years for it.
Tragic, to say the least. An ally turned enemy. I suppose the government can do that to people.
I suppose so.
How do you feel about him serving just three years for violations?
Do you think that was a light sentence, or a slap on the hand, given the illegalness of it all?

Kinda feel bad for him that his friends ratted him out. It IS a light sentence, but I guess he could have done worse. I dont know. Kinda tricky how one crime gets life, but doesn't necessarily "deserve" it.
and other crimes get a few years, like some cases of murder and such.
I will definitely need to see this movie. Have a great rest of your day!
As do I. They, after all, were accomplices to the fraud.

uid1response.feedback: The other user felt a little difficult to speak with. Their responses did not provide much material to further the conversation.
